instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840-A (No TrackPad)
threads.message:
I purchased this board used off eBay.

L4800 was blistered and smoked hard. I replaced this and cleaned damage around the area and also replaced U4830.
The board still has no trackpad.

5v is present on L4800 and voltages at U4830 all appear to be normal.
The 5v makes it all the way up to J4801 and I can't find corrosion damage on anything in this area.
I am a little nervous here because I am thinking the trackpad could of surged the CPU lines. This was a water damaged board.

Thoughts?

threads.title: 820-00840-A (No TrackPad)
threads.message:
Did you try known good trackpad board/flex?
Discard this first; probably liquid went on its circuitry.

threads.title: 820-00840-A (No TrackPad)
threads.message:
Yes.   I put the board in a known good MacBook.   I keep one of each model around for testing.
no Track pad in known good machine.

threads.title: 820-00840-A (No TrackPad)
threads.message:
F4800 is OK?
TP/KB not working at boot menu, nor OSX?
Correct LID_OPEN signal at J4801?
